intro: Phyllanthus thymoides var. ledifolius, commonly known as the narrow-leaf phyllanthus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are typically narrow and linear. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers clustered in inflorescences, which are often surrounded by bracts. It is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural studies.
